title: Fasting (Topical Study)
subtitle: Hungry for God
summary: A focused, seven-day exploration of fasting as worship, dependence, and justice.

days.title: Why fast?
days.summary: Learn the heart behind Biblical fasting and how it draws us to God’s presence.

readings.note: Fasting is assumed, not commanded, and anchored in secrecy before the Father.

prompts.question: What motivates you to fast: hunger for God or pressure to perform?
How can you keep fasting hidden and joyful?

reflection: Write a short prayer naming your desire for God above everything else.
What would a gentle fast look like for you this week?

days.title: Dependence
days.summary: Notice how fasting helps you remember your daily dependence on God’s provision.

readings.focus: Learning to live by every word from God
readings.note: Israel’s wilderness hunger trained them to trust God’s voice over visible provision.

prompts.question: What cravings surface when you feel empty?
Where do you sense God inviting you to listen more closely?

reflection: How is God meeting you in physical or emotional hunger?
Respond with gratitude for today’s manna.

days.title: Repentance and return
days.summary: Explore fasting as a doorway to confession and wholehearted return to God.

readings.focus: Return to Me with fasting and weeping
readings.note: God’s call is to rend our hearts, not just our garments.

prompts.question: Where is God inviting you to come home?
What would it look like to fast with your whole heart, not just outwardly?

reflection: List two areas to return to God today.
Pray for a soft heart that responds quickly to His mercy.

days.title: Justice and compassion
days.summary: Consider God’s desire for fasting that loosens injustice and cares for the vulnerable.

readings.note: God links fasting with generosity, hospitality, and advocacy.

prompts.question: Who around you needs tangible relief today?
How could your fast overflow in generosity?

reflection: Write a plan to share your resources during this fast.
Pray for eyes to see oppression the way God does.

days.title: Guidance and clarity
days.summary: Watch how the early church fasted to discern God’s direction and appoint leaders.

readings.note: Prayer and fasting accompanied the Spirit’s sending of Paul and Barnabas.

prompts.question: What decision are you seeking clarity on?
Who can fast and pray with you?

reflection: Invite the Spirit to speak into your next step.
Record any Scriptures or impressions that surface.
